item.title: Road safety / Visibility issue, 7th October
item.description:
I would like to raise a serious road safety concern at the junction of Caxton Street and Buckingham Gate (B323). When turning right from Caxton Street onto Buckingham Gate, parked vehicles on the corner completely block the view of oncoming traffic. This makes it impossible to see approaching vehicles and equally difficult for oncoming drivers to see vehicles emerging from Caxton Street. This junction presents a significant collision risk, particularly during busy hours. I kindly request the Council to consider either: • Installing Double Yellow Lines on this corner to prevent parking and improve visibility, or • Installing a Convex safety mirror across the road to allow drivers to see oncoming traffic. As shown in the attached photo, visibility is currently near zero when attempting to turn right, making this an urgent safety hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Caxton Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 206-216, Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contraflow cycle lane markings barely visible: needs re-painting please, 7th October
item.description:
The painted contraflow cycle lane on Thurland Road, between the junctions of Spa Rd and Old Jamaica Rd is very faded and barely visible. It needs repainting urgently please to make it safe. It’s so faded that it’s increasing the risk of collisions between cyclists using the cycle lane and oncoming motorists, who do not give cyclists enough space, as they can’t see the cycle lane, and cyclists and pedestrians walking along the pavement on Thurland Rd by St James' Church, as they don't know to look out for cyclists travelling South, as they can't see the cycle lane, and frequently step into the road without looking. I’ve seen several near misses. Please can this be fixed ASAP. It’s been this way for at least 3 months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurland Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
